definition: Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
fifth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fifth in order/letter "E" or Roman "V" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/penta
11th earthly branch: 7-9 p.m., 9th solar month (8th October-6th November), year of the Dog/ancient Chinese compass point: 300°
see 屈戌兒|屈戌儿[qu1 qu5 er5]
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: It is actually reflection of this view that she cruelly kept down the Movement of 1898.
sentences.chinese: 她殘酷地鎮壓戊戌變法運動就是這一基本思想的反映。

sentences.english: The Reform Movement of 1898 is a revolutionary movement of bourgeois nature.
sentences.chinese: 戊戌變法是一次資產階級性質的革命運動。

definition: mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
